trends: There have been 14 other sightings in Annapolis
There were no other sightings in Annapolis on or around June 10th 2009
divs: sighting detailslast night at approx. 9:30 pm my boyfriend and i were standing outside on our back patio. it was very cloudy outside - no stars or moon was visible. i happened to glance up in the sky - if 12:00 is directly over my head - at my 1:00 position in the sw sky i noticed a small dull white\yellow light, positioned just below the dense cloud cover we had last night. the light was displaying what i would describe as very unusual flight characterics. the size of the light would be equivalent to the top of a pencil eraser should you extend at arms length. as far as color goes the light was a "dirty" white\yellow. the light would "flare" in intensity at a complete stand still then glide\slide a short distance in the sky - come to a complete halt - flare again, then glide\slide the same distance as previously moved - it repeated this flight "pattern" the whole way across the sky in a direct line over my right shoulder until it seemed to get lost in the cloud cover. the spaces it moved in between the stops was equal to 9 or 10 inches if you were to hold a ruler out at arms length. when the light stopped and "flared" it stopped for what i would say was one second. it moved at a very fast pace. when i first spotted the light i said to my boyfriend - who was facing me at the time - "what the heck is that?". by the time he could turn his head around and focus on the area of sky where i had pointed the light had moved so fast over my right should he missed seeing it. this is the flight pattern: o --------- o ---------- o ----------- o ----------- the "o" above was where it came to a complete halt, the light flaring in intensity then moved ahead a little stopped and repeated the process over again. i would be very interested to know if anyone has any idea what this might have been. i'm not sure maryland has a mufon director but any of the nearby states are more than welcome to contact me.
Summary: Light displaying very unusual flight characteristics.
